text: president Trump has said the US states
of Texas and Vermont will allow certain
businesses to reopen from Monday at the
daily White House briefing mr. Trump
said there were signs that the virus had
passed its peak in major cities around
the country demonstrators have been
demanding an end to the stay at home
orders professor Brahma Mukherjee who
was professor of global health and
epidemiology at the University of
Michigan said the US would have to be
careful as it eased the lockdown I want
to filter out the political biases an
agenda from the scientific conversation
so what I'm interested in is working
with my colleagues in economics and
policy to come back to with an optimal
route to come back to normal in the fact
is we just have slowed down in our case
cons we have not turned the corner in
many places and there are new Peaks
coming out so it would be quite
short-sighted to open in a nasty way and
really undo the social distancing work
that all of us have done together and
humans are finally ultimately beating
the dire model projections that so we
have to be really careful as we reopen
so I think we have to go through a step
of stabilization and then reactivating
the workforce so that's that's own
opinion and that it's not the question
of the number of case concert time but
we have to look around and say that are
we ready to follow the three principles
of test trace and treat and then work on
the viral control and the economic
recovery simultaneously professor Brahma
Mukherjee speaking to me a little
earlier South Korea has reported only
eight new coronavirus cases in the last
24 hours
it's the first time in two months that

remember that's the same day as the

of coronavirus the difference here was
that within 17 days this country had
created a test
and a hundred laboratories ready to
process those tests right from the
outset they decided to go after this

end of February when I was in the

around a hundred ambulances lining
outside to the hospital I said to
officials are you ever going to get this
under control they said to me at the

eight weeks later here we are and they
were have narrow downst-- eight new
cases in the last six days it's all been
under 20 daily new cases and it's worth
mentioning Rita that five of those eight
new cases today come from overseas
arrivals where they're testing everyone
at the airport and also demanding that
everyone arriving undergo 14 days
quarantine and what was it in South

determination had it been previous
experience and South Korea had been
exposed to SARS hadn't it yeah so it's
not just Sarris it was MERS it was
Middle East respiratory syndrome back in
South Korea had the worst outbreak
outside of the Middle East and at that
time they realized that they couldn't
trace where patient zero had come from
and where he had traveled to and at that
point they recreated laws to try to
track and trace those with the infection
so it means that right now the
government can if I had coronavirus the
government would track me using my phone
I would also be required to fill in
details of how I was feeling each day
the minute that I went outside my
quarantine area the phone would ring so
that's the kind of tracking and tracing
measures they are used also at the time
I would have been told that the David
the first patient was diagnosed they
started to realize how contagious this

others came up with other tests so
that's how they've managed to do it

kind of
private partnership which is a load
